intro: Rabdosia shimizuana, commonly known as the Shimanza herb, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its square stems, opposite leaves, and clusters of small, tubular flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in horticulture.
